sect1.title: Scripting Basics
sect1.para: Scripting a powerful tool that allows BEEN to be extended more easily by allowing user to use code written not only in Java, but also in languages that are believed to make development more effective for some types of tasks. Currently BEEN supports scripts in two languages: Python and Shell scripts. Both of these languages have some advantages and disadvantages and will take a closer look on them later in this chapter.

sect3.title: Jython Scripting
sect3.para: Jython is pure Java scripting language fully compatible with Python. In addition to Python compatibility, Jython is also Java compatible (Jython script can import java classes and call java methods as if they were written in Python). As a result, you can write Python scripts that will be executed as BEEN tasks and from these script you can still easily interact with BEEN environment just as from regular BEEN task written in Java.

sect3.title: Shell Scripting
sect3.para: Another scripting language supported by BEEN is platform dependent shell. BEEN's ability to execute shell scripts can be very useful for example when you have a lot of build scripts you want to use in your benchmarks.

From their nature, shell scripts are platform dependent. This means, whenever you're running a shell script as a task, you should be aware which platform is that script running on and supply a script that is compatible with that platform (so you supply a Bash script for Linux host or Windows script for host running of Windows).
